titles: [An elegy] upon Marsh's one of [the two publick sworn informers against Protestant] religious meetings in the city of London, who [lately dyed very miserably in the prison of] the Counter.
notes: Verse: "GO set Scotch Bag-Pipes to the briskest Notes ..."
Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Imperfect: stained, affecting title; portions of title suggested by EAE and OCL in OCLC.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  Politics and government --  1660-1688 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
